00009 class Edge{
00010 public:
00011   Edge()
00012   { init(); }
00013 
00014   Edge(VertAttrib::vi V0, VertAttrib::vi V1, FaceAttrib::vi F0, 
00015        FaceAttrib::vi F1)
00016   {
00017     init();
00018 
00019     // We want the order to be similar to that in the faces --
00020     // If we start rotation about V0 with face F0, we want F1 to be
00021     // the last face in the (circular linked) list before F1
00022     A_V[0] = V0;
00023     A_V[1] = V1;
00024     if(F0 != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI){
00025       if(F0->next(V0) == F1){
00026         A_nbrs[0] = F1;
00027         A_nbrs[1] = F0;
00028       }else{
00029         A_nbrs[0] = F0;
00030         A_nbrs[1] = F1;
00031       }
00032     }else if(F1 != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI){
00033       if(F1->next(V1) == F0){
00034         A_nbrs[0] = F1;
00035         A_nbrs[1] = F0;
00036       }else{
00037         A_nbrs[0] = F0;
00038         A_nbrs[1] = F1;
00039       }
00040     }
00041   }
00042 
00043   Edge(const Edge& E)
00044   {
00045     init();
00046     do_copy(E);
00047   }
00048 
00049   const Edge&
00050   operator=(const Edge& E)
00051   {
00052     if(this != &E) do_copy(E);
00053     return *this;
00054   }
00055 
00056   ~Edge()
00057   { ; }
00058 
00059   void
00060   get_verts(VertAttrib::vi *A, VertAttrib::vi *B) const
00061   {
00062     *A = A_V[0];
00063     *B = A_V[1];
00064   }
00065 
00066   void
00067   get_faces(FaceAttrib::vi *A, FaceAttrib::vi *B) const
00068   {
00069     *A = A_nbrs[0];
00070     *B = A_nbrs[1];
00071   }
00072 
00073 private:
00074   void 
00075   init();
00076 #if 0
00077   {
00078     std::fill(A_V, A_V + 2, VertAttrib::NULL_VI);
00079     std::fill(A_nbrs, A_nbrs + 2, FaceAttrib::NULL_VI);
00080   }
00081 #endif
00082 
00083   void
00084   do_copy(const Edge& E)
00085   {
00086     std::copy(E.A_V, E.A_V + 2, A_V);
00087     std::copy(E.A_nbrs, E.A_nbrs + 2, A_nbrs);
00088   }
00089 
00090   VertAttrib::vi A_V[2];      
00091   FaceAttrib::vi A_nbrs[2];  
00092 };

00096 class SimpleTrimeshThree{
00097 public:
00098 
00100   SimpleTrimeshThree();
00101 
00102   ~SimpleTrimeshThree()
00103   { ; }
00104 
00105   bool
00106   read_vert_file(const std::string fname, const bool sample_surface = false);
00107 
00108   bool
00109   read_face_file(const std::string fname, std::vector<Edge> *edges,
00110                  const bool check_vertex_order, 
00111                  const bool compute_max_dist_to_centroid);
00112 
00115   const bool
00116   fail() const
00117   { return A_fail; }
00118 
00119   const size_t
00120   num_verts() const
00121   { return A_vertices.size(); }
00122 
00123   // This is public for now -- testing
00126   void
00127   initialize_opt(std::vector<Edge> &edges);
00128 
00129   const my_float_t
00130   max_dist_to_centroid() const
00131   { return A_max_dist_to_cent; }
00132 
00133   VertAttrib::vci
00134   vertices_begin() const
00135   { return A_vertices.begin(); }
00136 
00137   VertAttrib::vci
00138   vertices_end() const
00139   { return A_vertices.end(); }
00140 
00141   FaceAttrib::vci
00142   faces_begin() const
00143   { return A_faces.begin(); }
00144 
00145   FaceAttrib::vci
00146   faces_end() const
00147   { return A_faces.end(); }
00148 
00149 protected:
00150   void
00151   set_fail_flag()
00152   { A_fail = true; }
00153 
00154 private:
00156 
00164   bool
00165   get_faces(const VertAttrib::vi &central_vert,
00166             const FaceAttrib::vi &start_face,
00167             std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> *faces_out,
00168             const bool skip_first_prev = false)
00169   {
00170     if(start_face == FaceAttrib::NULL_VI) return false;
00171     FaceAttrib::vi F = start_face->next(central_vert);
00172     for( ; F != start_face && F != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI;  
00173         F = F->next(central_vert))
00174       faces_out->push_back(F);
00175 
00176     // Try the prev links if there is a "gap"
00177     if(F == FaceAttrib::NULL_VI){
00178       F = start_face->prev(central_vert); 
00179       if(F != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI && skip_first_prev) F = F->prev(central_vert);
00180       for( ; F != start_face && F != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI;  
00181           F = F->prev(central_vert))
00182         faces_out->push_back(F);
00183     }
00184   }
00185 
00187   void
00188   get_faces(const Edge &E, std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> *faces_out)
00189   {
00190     VertAttrib::vi end_pts[2];
00191     FaceAttrib::vi edge_faces[2];
00192     E.get_verts(&end_pts[0], &end_pts[1]);
00193     E.get_faces(&edge_faces[0], &edge_faces[1]);
00194 
00195     // get_faces does not add the starting face to the vector
00196     // this way faces do not get counted twice
00197     get_faces(end_pts[0], edge_faces[0], faces_out);
00198     get_faces(end_pts[1], edge_faces[1], faces_out);
00199   }
00200 
00201   bool
00202   get_faces(FaceAttrib::vi central_face, 
00203             std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> *faces_out)
00204   {
00205     faces_out->push_back(central_face);
00206 
00207     VertAttrib::vi central_verts[3];
00208     central_face->get_vertices(central_verts);
00209 
00210     // The nice idea gets messier here when we try to deal with 
00211     // special cases.  Ideally, we would traverse each circular array
00212     // starting with the next face after the central face and not add
00213     // the starting face for that traversal as it is covered by the 
00214     // (next, previous) traversel.  When we hit boundaries, we use
00215     // prev as well to see how far we can get, if the next face does not
00216     // exist then we need to start with the central face and we do not
00217     // want get_faces to add central face
00218     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00219       FaceAttrib::vi next_face = central_face->next(central_verts[i]);
00220       if(next_face != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI)
00221         get_faces(central_verts[i], next_face, faces_out, true);
00222       else
00223         get_faces(central_verts[i], central_face, faces_out, false);
00224     }
00225   }
00226 
00227 
00228   inline void
00229   face_centroid(const VertAttrib::vi *V, my_float_t *centroid)
00230   {
00231     std::copy(V[0]->pos, V[0]->pos + 3, centroid);
00232     my_axpy(3, 1.0, V[1]->pos, 1, centroid, 1);
00233     my_axpy(3, 1.0, V[2]->pos, 1, centroid, 1);
00234     for(size_t j = 0; j < 3; ++j) centroid[j] /= 3.0;
00235   }
00236 
00237 
00238   dir_point_storage<VertAttrib> A_vertices;
00239   std::vector<FaceAttrib> A_faces;
00240   point_storage<point_t> A_sample_pts; 
00241   my_float_t A_max_dist_to_cent;
00242   bool A_fail;
00243 
00244 };
